pullrequest.title: parse model.config such that it allows <model><urdf>file.urdf</urdf></model>.

content.raw: URDF's don't work for everyone. If we put this tag in, then we have to make sure that all URDF's accepted into the model database do not have ROS specific elements (xacro, packge://).
content.html: URDF's don't work for everyone. If we put this tag in, then we have to make sure that all URDF's accepted into the model database do not have ROS specific elements (xacro, packge://).

pullrequest.title: parse model.config such that it allows <model><urdf>file.urdf</urdf></model>.

content.raw:
well... xacro is not part of urdf, so we are not offering support for it by adding `<urdf>` tags here (just like irb script is not part of sdf)? maybe we can start steering ros urdf users to use irb?

but `package://` implies resolving path by means of [ros resource retriever](http://wiki.ros.org/resource_retriever), currently we don't plan on resolving ros package paths.  Current urdf parser in sdf replaces `package://` by `model://`, which requires packages to be a gazebo model resources as well (i.e. has both `package.xml` and `model.config`...
content.html:
well... xacro is not part of urdf, so we are not offering support for it by adding <urdf> tags here (just like irb script is not part of sdf)? maybe we can start steering ros urdf users to use irb?

but package:// implies resolving path by means of ros resource retriever, currently we don't plan on resolving ros package paths. Current urdf parser in sdf replaces package:// by model://, which requires packages to be a gazebo model resources as well (i.e. has both package.xml and model.config...

pullrequest.title: parse model.config such that it allows <model><urdf>file.urdf</urdf></model>.

content.raw: I don't believe this change affects the model database at all - URDFs already could work in the model database, but as you said they probably should not be added unless you have ROS specific elements. This change is just semantic so you don't have <sdf>robot.urdf</sdf>
content.html: I don't believe this change affects the model database at all - URDFs already could work in the model database, but as you said they probably should not be added unless you have ROS specific elements. This change is just semantic so you don't have <sdf>robot.urdf</sdf>

pullrequest.title: parse model.config such that it allows <model><urdf>file.urdf</urdf></model>.

content.raw: Right. I agree with the semantic value. My previous comment is just a reminder that after we do this, we have to keep an eye out for pull requests to the `gazebo_model` that may include ROS specific elements.
content.html: Right. I agree with the semantic value. My previous comment is just a reminder that after we do this, we have to keep an eye out for pull requests to the gazebo_model that may include ROS specific elements.

pullrequest.title: parse model.config such that it allows <model><urdf>file.urdf</urdf></model>.
